I have had a problem with trying to do an EVA while in earths orbit with no propulsion active but when I do, my Kerbal gets out of the pod and releases his grip and starts floating away, but when I am grounded or landing with a parachute he hold on like no problem. What am I doing wrong???

Edited December 18, 2014 by pumper578

Nothing. There was a bug in .25, (or a feature designed to force you to learn Kerbal spacewalking and maneuver) that has a workaround .dll that you can add that helps the situation considerably. Do a search in the bugs forum.

Do a search in the bugs forum.

Or you can click on my signature link.

(Updates pending for 0.90, but your particular requested bugfix still works: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-0-25-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules)

Cheers,

~Claw
Thanks Man, Downloading bugfix now. I looked around before I asked, but i guess I searched the wrong terminology. "EVA problem" brought too many searches.....
